creditline: The Marguertie S. McNally Endowment for Art Acquisition
description: abstract animal shape; four legs; lozenge-shaped body; long horns and long pointed ears; one cowrie shell hanging from element on animal's forehead; maroon thread tassels at ends of ears; black patina; attached to dark wood base
dimension: 24 1/16 x 8 1/2 x 3 in. (61.12 x 21.59 x 7.62 cm) (including base)
markings: on bottom of base, on sticker: [(loss) Lecomte / Paris]
text: A Tyiwara headcrest should be seen in profile to appreciate the sculptor’s visual imagination: the dynamic beauty of the design, the balance of its elements. Like the Greek chimera, the Tyiwara is a composite creature, its features drawn from the antelope, pangolin, and aardvark, a mythical animal that taught humans how to farm. When used in agricultural ceremonies, the crest is mounted on a dancer’s braided hat.
title: Tyiwara headcrest
